The liquid produced in this video is just tannic acid one of the components in traditional ink. You'd need to add an Iron salt to it to make what is traditionally known as Iron Gall ink, which was made from oak galls but walnuts work well too. The reason you want to add the iron salts to the tannic acid is because without it the tannins aren't very dark, but the Iron will darken into a true black as it dries.

Making a quill pen is a specialized art.  For a first try, you made a respectable pen.  A suggestion to harden the quill before you cut the nib is to place the tip of the quill into a bowl of heated sand for about 15 minutes.  This hardens the quill and you don't have to cut so much off of the tip to make your nib.
